results.title: Viridiana
results.creator_credit: Luis Bunuel, Ricardo Munoz Suay, Gustavo Alatriste, Films 59 and Uninci
results.brief_description: A novice about to take her vows, who has been abused and cheated by her uncle and his illegitimate son, opens up the former’s house to a collection of cripples and beggars. A savage attack on Catholic mentality and rituals, this powerful psychological study was Bunuel’s first film made in his native Spain for over twenty-five years and his last for many more. Although the script had been unaccountably passed by Franco’s censors, the film itself was banned outright in Spain. The notorious set-piece of ‘The Last Supper’ being enacted by social outcasts also caused the Vatican to condemn it. Cast includes Silvia Pinal, Fernando Rey and Francisco Rabal. In Spanish with English subtitles.

results.title: Videodrome
results.creator_credit: David Cronenberg, Claude Heroux, Filmplan International and Guardian Trust Company
results.brief_description: Sci-fi horror filmmaker David Cronenberg’s diabolical invader is a television show that seduces and controls its viewers. Featuring Deborah Harry as a kinky hostess, James Woods as a cable programmer looking for the ultimate in viewing thrills, this is a pulsating science fiction nightmare about a world where video can insidiously control and alter human life.

results.title: Very Annie Mary
results.creator_credit: Sara Sugarman, Graham Broadbent, Damian Jones, Arts Council of Great Britain, Studio Canal+, Arts Council of Wales and Film Four International
results.brief_description: Annie Mary (Rachel Griffiths) is a simple-minded, clumsy, and kind-hearted twenty-something still living at home with her domineering, hypocritical, Pavarotti loving father in a small country town. Denied the chance to study singing in Milan at age sixteen due to the death of her mother, Annie has given up singing altogether and is barely hanging onto dregs of a dull romance with Colin, a man whom she has to bribe for sex. Just when it seems she may have a chance to have a life of her own, Annie Mary’s father has a stroke, and she is forced to take the reigns of his bakery and care for him at home. When Annie Mary realises that her best friend is dying, she desperately tries to raise money for a trip to Disneyland by forming a pop group and entering a talent contest, with one thousand pounds in prize money. A comedy of sorts, “Very Annie Mary” features several song and dance routines in the mode of “The Full Monty” and like that film, the depressed economy is the backdrop against which the townspeople hope to illicit a modicum of happiness from their penny pinching lives. Director Sara Sugarman is also responsible for the script.

results.title: Unzipped
results.creator_credit: Douglas Keeve, Michael Alden and Hachette Fillpacchi Productions
results.brief_description: Isaac Mizrahi is a talented New York fashion designer, who, after receiving negative reviews for his 1994 Spring collection, is in need of a successful season. This documentary tracks the evolution of Mizrahi’s next collection - from fledging moments of inspiration to final parade. “Unzipped” is a frank examination of the fashion industry at work - the superficiality, demands, personalities, exhaustion, frustrations, setbacks, camaraderie and creativity of it all. Supermodels take centre stage and the precociousness of this elite group is in evident abundance. Mizrahi seeks guidance from a diverse range of sources (including a ouija board) as he aims to evoke the look and style of an Inuit, mixed with 1950s cheesecake aesthetic, meets Mary Tyler Moore. Mizrahi’s mother is interviewed and gives insights into her son’s precocious talent, recognised and nurtured by her. Directed by Douglas Keeve, “Unzipped” is a candid examination of the sparks that fly when creative urges seek to ally financial interest. Features appearances from Naomi Campbell, Linda Evangelista, Cindy Crawford, Helena Christensen, Richard Gere, Eartha Kitt, Sandra Bernhard and Kate Moss. Winner of the Audience Award at the 1995 Sundance Film Festival.

results.title: Unknown Chaplin
results.creator_credit: Thames Television, Kevin Brownlow and David Gill
results.brief_description: A three part series which both surveys and throws new light on Chaplin’s career in films. The first part, My Happiest Years, covers his work in 2 reel comedies. The second part, The Great Dictator, covers his early years as the independent producer of The Kid and The Gold Rush. The third part, Hidden Treasures, includes previously unseen home movies and scenes cut from the release prints of City Lights and Modern Times. Narrated by James Mason.

results.title: Universal soldier
results.creator_credit: Roland Emmerich, Joel B Michaels, Craig Baumgarten, Allen Shapiro and Corolco Pictures
results.brief_description: Vietnam soldiers Luc Devreaux (Jean-Claude Van Damme), and Andrew Scott (Dolph Lundgren) are killed in combat. Their bodies are used in a secret government experiment of mixing man with machine. The two were sworn enemies in life and the experiment was supposed to have erased all memories but they rediscover the fierce hate between them as two fighting machines battle one another to the death. Also starring Ally Walker, Ed O’Ross and Jerry Orbach. This video contains 11 minutes of extra footage not screened in cinemas.

results.title: Une Bombe par hasard
results.brief_description: An animated film in which a stranger comes upon a town and notes the total absence of populace. The townspeople, from their safe position on the hill, watch with concern as the stranger approaches the bomb. In the end only the stranger escapes the explosion.

results.title: Uncut
results.brief_description: This low budget experimental genre-bending exercise from Canadian director John Greyson revolves around the themes of censorship, circumcision and copyright. Greyson interweaves fiction and fact whilst commentating upon the vagaries of popular culture, with an examination of the history of censorship, raging against the conservatism of the era that does not recognise the importance of historical accuracy and truths. The fictional component of the film is set in Ottawa in 1979 and revolves around the fortunes of three Peters - one is writing a book against circumcision; the second is his typist who nurses an obsession with Canadian Prime Minister Pierre Trudeau; the third is a sinister presence who becomes intimately acquainted with the other two. The documentary component of the film (inter-cut with the fictional elements) concerns copyright laws and examines how such laws are homophobic and hamper creativity whilst protecting the rights and creative output of the rich and famous. Although this work is elliptical, it provides a fascinating cornucopia of issues from the perspective of a polemicist, presenting an irreverent and independent viewpoint about gay politics and mass culture. Cast includes Matthew Ferguson, Michael Achtman, Damon D’Oliveira.

results.title: Uncivilised
results.brief_description: This is the story of Beatrice Lynn, a high society author, who heads into the wilds of northern Australia in search of an Aboriginal tribe ruled by a white king, Mara. Along the way she is kidnapped and taken through the bush, encountering pituri smugglers, and battling a killer before finally being sold to Mara. In the tradition of true melodramas a love conflict develops between the white chief and Beatrice and leads to an epic Chauvel finale. Filmed in North Queensland and Palm Island and featuring spectacular rainforest and river cinematography, director Chauvel made this film in an attempt to break into the American market. Censorship problems relating to nude swimming as well as violence were eventually overcome for the Australian release while a censored version was released on the overseas market.

results.title: Unbreakable
results.creator_credit: M Night Shyamalan, Sam Mercer, Barry Mendel, Limited Edition Productions Inc., Blinding Edge Pictures and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: Unbreakable is the follow-up film for M. Night Shyamalan after his worldwide hit “The Sixth sense”. Bruce Willis stars as David Dunn, an everyman character, a security guard and father of one, whose marriage is undergoing a crisis. David is the only survivor of a horrific train crash and miraculously is completely unharmed. Just after the crash David is befriended by Elijah Price aka Mr Glass (Samuel L. Jackson), a man suffering from the opposite syndrome - he is as fragile as cotton wool and has spent his entire life recovering from broken bones. Price runs a comic book store specialising in original comic book cells and has a genuine belief that superheroes exist in real life. These two men of opposing physical make-ups are brought together and discover that their destinies are strangely linked. David slowly comes to realise that he has extrasensory powers and superhuman strength that render him unbreakable. “Unbreakable” is a thriller, a classic good versus evil tale that explores the notion of supernatural forces at work in the world. Cast also includes Robin Wright Penn.
